feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 8:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY... A quick moving but moist atmospheric river will move across the area starting Tuesday and persist into Wednesday evening. Streams and rivers will rise rapidly but at this time are expected to remain within their banks. Rain amounts will range from 1.5 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts possible. The heaviest precipitation

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 10:41PM MST until August 15 at 1:30AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MST MONDAY FOR CHINLE CREEK IN APACHE COUNTY... At 1039 PM MST, rain has ended over the region, but heavy rain from earlier this evening has caused flooding in Chinle Creek from near Chinle north to near the Utah state line. Flash flooding is already occurring.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 11:57PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG NEAR LAKE SUPERIOR EARLY THIS MORNING... Locally dense fog is expected near Lake Superior overnight, from Grand Portage to Duluth, MN to Saxon Harbor, WI. This includes the North Shore, Twin Ports, and portions of northwest Wisconsin along and north of US Highway 2. Visibility will be variable from location to location and may be less than 1/4 mile at times.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 12:51AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog Early This Morning... Skies have cleared over parts of central Wisconsin allowing for areas of dense fog to develop. Visibilities may occasionally be reduced to 1/4 mile at times. Drive with caution early this morning and be prepared for rapid reductions in visibilities. Slow down and use your low beams.

Visibility will be variable from location to location and may be less than 1/4 mile at times.
